storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my assigned performance metrics and review schedule to prepare for evaluations

testCases.title: Validate dashboard displays assigned metrics and review cycles
preconditions: Employee user account exists in the system
Employee has at least one performance metric assigned
Employee has at least one review cycle scheduled
System is accessible and operational
Valid employee credentials are available

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid employee credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is authenticated and redirected to the Performance Dashboard

steps.action: Verify the Performance Dashboard loads completely
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads successfully within 3 seconds showing metrics and review cycles sections

steps.action: Review the list of assigned performance metrics displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: All assigned metrics are displayed with metric names, targets, current values, and status indicators

steps.action: Review the list of review cycles displayed on the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: All upcoming and active review cycles are displayed with cycle names, start dates, end dates, and current status

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of displayed metrics against expected assignments
steps.expectedResult: All metrics match the employee's assigned metrics with correct details

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of review cycle dates and status
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle dates and status indicators are accurate and match scheduled information

steps.action: Locate and click the Export to PDF button
steps.expectedResult: Export dialog appears with PDF format selected

steps.action: Confirm the export action
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and downloaded successfully

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF contains all assigned metrics with targets and review schedules with accurate dates and status

postconditions: Employee remains logged into the system
Dashboard data remains unchanged
PDF export file is saved to local download folder
No data modifications occurred during the test

testCases.title: Ensure dashboard access is restricted to logged-in employee
preconditions: Two employee user accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged into the system
Employee B's dashboard URL is known
System security and authorization mechanisms are active

steps.action: Log in as Employee A with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is successfully authenticated and redirected to their dashboard

steps.action: Note the current dashboard URL for Employee A
steps.expectedResult: URL is captured showing Employee A's user identifier or dashboard path

steps.action: Manually modify the URL in the browser address bar to Employee B's dashboard URL
steps.expectedResult: URL is changed in the address bar

steps.action: Press Enter to navigate to Employee B's dashboard URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with an appropriate error message such as 'Access Denied' or 'Unauthorized Access' (HTTP 403 or 401)

steps.action: Verify that no data from Employee B's dashboard is displayed
steps.expectedResult: No performance metrics or review cycles belonging to Employee B are visible

steps.action: Verify the user is redirected back to Employee A's dashboard or an error page
steps.expectedResult: User is either redirected to their own dashboard or shown a proper error page without exposing unauthorized data

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own data
No unauthorized access to Employee B's data occurred
Security logs record the unauthorized access attempt
System maintains data integrity and security

storyTitle: As Performance Manager, I want to receive automated notifications for upcoming review cycles to ensure timely evaluations

testCases.title: Validate scheduled notification delivery
preconditions: Performance Manager account exists with appropriate permissions
Email server is configured and operational
In-app notification system is functional
At least one review cycle exists in the system
Manager is logged into the system
Notification templates are configured

steps.action: Log in as Performance Manager with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the Review Cycle Management section
steps.expectedResult: Review Cycle Management page is displayed with list of existing review cycles

steps.action: Select a specific review cycle for notification configuration
steps.expectedResult: Review cycle details page opens showing cycle information and notification settings

steps.action: Click on Configure Notifications button
steps.expectedResult: Notification configuration interface is displayed with scheduling options

steps.action: Set notification schedule to trigger in 5 minutes from current time
steps.expectedResult: Notification schedule fields accept the time input

steps.action: Select both Email and In-app notification delivery methods
steps.expectedResult: Both delivery method checkboxes are checked

steps.action: Click Save to save the notification schedule
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming schedule is saved successfully, and configuration is stored in the system

steps.action: Wait for the scheduled notification time (5 minutes)
steps.expectedResult: Time elapses and scheduled notification time is reached

steps.action: Check the manager's email inbox for the notification
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received within 1 hour of scheduled time with correct review cycle information

steps.action: Check the in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification alert is displayed with review cycle details and unread status

steps.action: Click on the in-app notification to acknowledge it
steps.expectedResult: Notification is marked as read and acknowledgment timestamp is recorded

steps.action: Navigate to notification logs or audit trail
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery log shows successful delivery status, delivery timestamp, and acknowledgment timestamp

postconditions: Notification schedule remains active for future cycles
Notification delivery is logged in the system
User acknowledgment is recorded with timestamp
Email and in-app notifications are marked as delivered and read

testCases.title: Verify user can customize notification preferences
preconditions: User account exists in the system (Manager or Employee)
User has access to notification preferences settings
Default notification preferences are already configured
User is logged into the system
At least one notification type is available for configuration

steps.action: Log in with valid user credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the main dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to user profile or settings menu
steps.expectedResult: Settings menu is displayed with various configuration options

steps.action: Click on Notification Preferences option
steps.expectedResult: Notification Preferences page is displayed showing current notification settings

steps.action: Review the current notification preferences displayed
steps.expectedResult: Current settings show notification types, delivery methods (email/in-app), and opt-in/opt-out status

steps.action: Change email notification setting from enabled to disabled for review cycle reminders
steps.expectedResult: Email notification toggle switches to disabled state

steps.action: Change in-app notification setting from disabled to enabled for performance metric updates
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification toggle switches to enabled state

steps.action: Modify notification frequency preference from immediate to daily digest
steps.expectedResult: Frequency dropdown updates to show daily digest selected

steps.action: Click Save or Update Preferences button
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming preferences are saved successfully

steps.action: Log out and log back in to verify persistence
steps.expectedResult: User is logged out and then successfully logs back in

steps.action: Navigate back to Notification Preferences page
steps.expectedResult: Notification Preferences page displays the updated settings matching the changes made

steps.action: Trigger a test notification for review cycle reminders
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is sent (as per disabled preference), confirming settings are applied

steps.action: Trigger a test notification for performance metric updates
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed (as per enabled preference), confirming settings are respected

steps.action: Verify that suppressed notifications are not delivered
steps.expectedResult: Email inbox shows no review cycle reminder emails, confirming opt-out is working

postconditions: User notification preferences are updated in the database
Future notifications respect the updated preferences
User remains logged into the system
Notification preference changes are logged in audit trail

storyTitle: As Performance Analyst, I want to generate reports on performance metrics and review cycles to analyze trends and outcomes

testCases.title: Validate report generation with filters
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Analyst
Performance metrics data exists in the system
At least one review cycle has been completed
User has appropriate permissions to access reporting features
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the Reporting page from the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Reporting page is displayed with options to select metrics, review cycles, and filters. Page loads within 3 seconds

steps.action: Select desired performance metrics from the metrics dropdown (e.g., Goal Completion Rate, Performance Score)
steps.expectedResult: Selected metrics are highlighted and displayed in the selection panel

steps.action: Select one or more review cycles from the review cycle dropdown (e.g., Q1 2024, Q2 2024)
steps.expectedResult: Selected review cycles are highlighted and displayed in the selection panel

steps.action: Apply filters by selecting date range (e.g., January 1, 2024 to March 31, 2024)
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter is applied and displayed in the active filters section

steps.action: Apply additional filters by selecting department (e.g., Engineering, Sales)
steps.expectedResult: Department filter is applied and displayed in the active filters section

steps.action: Apply role filter by selecting specific roles (e.g., Manager, Individual Contributor)
steps.expectedResult: Role filter is applied and displayed in the active filters section

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report generation begins with a loading indicator displayed. Report completes generation within 5 seconds

steps.action: Review the generated report display
steps.expectedResult: Report displays trend charts showing performance metrics over time with proper axis labels and legends. Summary tables show aggregated data filtered by selected criteria. Data matches the applied filters (date, department, role)

steps.action: Verify the accuracy of displayed data by comparing with source data
steps.expectedResult: Report data is accurate with 95% or higher accuracy rate. All filtered data points are correctly represented in charts and tables

postconditions: Report is successfully generated and displayed on screen
Report data reflects all applied filters
System logs the report generation activity
Report remains accessible for export or further analysis
User session remains active

testCases.title: Validate report export functionality
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Analyst
User has successfully generated a report with metrics and filters
Report is currently displayed on screen
User has appropriate permissions to export reports
Browser download settings allow automatic downloads
Sufficient disk space available for file downloads

steps.action: Verify that a report is currently displayed on the Reporting page
steps.expectedResult: Report is visible with trend charts and summary tables containing filtered performance data

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Export' button or dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu is displayed showing available formats (PDF and Excel)

steps.action: Select 'Export to PDF' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: PDF export process initiates with a progress indicator. PDF file is generated and downloaded to the default download location within 5 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file using a PDF reader
steps.expectedResult: PDF file opens successfully without errors. File contains all report elements including charts, tables, headers, and footers. Data in PDF matches the on-screen report exactly. Charts are rendered clearly with proper resolution. All applied filters are documented in the report header

steps.action: Return to the Reporting page and click the 'Export' button again
steps.expectedResult: Export options menu is displayed again

steps.action: Select 'Export to Excel' option from the export menu
steps.expectedResult: Excel export process initiates with a progress indicator. Excel file (.xlsx) is generated and downloaded to the default download location within 5 seconds

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file using Microsoft Excel or compatible spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully without errors. File contains multiple sheets if applicable (Summary, Detailed Data, Charts). Data in Excel matches the on-screen report exactly. All numerical data is formatted correctly and editable. Charts are embedded as Excel chart objects. Column headers are properly labeled. All applied filters are documented in a summary sheet

steps.action: Verify data integrity by spot-checking key metrics in both PDF and Excel exports against the on-screen report
steps.expectedResult: All data points match across all three formats (on-screen, PDF, Excel) with 100% accuracy

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Excel file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Both exported files are accessible and readable
Original report remains displayed on screen
Export activity is logged in the system
User session remains active

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to manage user roles and permissions for performance monitoring features to ensure secure access control

testCases.title: Validate role creation and assignment
preconditions: User is logged in as System Administrator
User has full administrative privileges
User Management page is accessible
At least one user account exists in the system for role assignment
Performance monitoring features are configured and available
Database connection is active and stable

steps.action: Navigate to the User Management page from the admin dashboard or main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: User Management page is displayed showing existing users, roles, and management options. Page loads within 3 seconds

steps.action: Click on the 'Roles' tab or 'Manage Roles' button
steps.expectedResult: Roles management interface is displayed showing list of existing roles and a 'Create New Role' button

steps.action: Click the 'Create New Role' button
steps.expectedResult: Role creation form is displayed with fields for role name, description, and permissions checkboxes

steps.action: Enter a unique role name (e.g., 'Performance Reviewer') in the role name field
steps.expectedResult: Role name is accepted and displayed in the input field without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a description for the role (e.g., 'Can view and review performance metrics but cannot generate reports')
steps.expectedResult: Description is accepted and displayed in the description field

steps.action: Select specific permissions from the available options by checking relevant checkboxes (e.g., 'View Performance Metrics', 'View Review Cycles', but not 'Generate Reports' or 'Export Data')
steps.expectedResult: Selected permissions are checked and highlighted. Permission count updates to reflect selections

steps.action: Click the 'Save Role' or 'Create Role' button
steps.expectedResult: Role is created successfully. Success message is displayed (e.g., 'Role created successfully'). New role appears in the roles list. System logs the role creation with timestamp and admin user ID

steps.action: Navigate to the 'Users' tab or section within User Management
steps.expectedResult: Users list is displayed showing all user accounts with their current roles

steps.action: Select a user from the list by clicking on their name or 'Edit' button
steps.expectedResult: User details page or modal is displayed showing user information and current role assignments

steps.action: Click on 'Assign Role' or 'Edit Roles' button
steps.expectedResult: Role assignment interface is displayed with a dropdown or list of available roles including the newly created role

steps.action: Select the newly created role (e.g., 'Performance Reviewer') from the available roles list
steps.expectedResult: Role is selected and highlighted in the interface

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Assign' button to assign the role to the user
steps.expectedResult: Role is assigned successfully. Success message is displayed (e.g., 'Role assigned successfully'). User's role list is updated to include the new role. System logs the role assignment with timestamp and admin user ID

steps.action: Verify that the role assignment takes effect immediately by checking the user's permissions
steps.expectedResult: User's permissions are updated immediately without requiring logout or system restart. User now has access to features defined by the assigned role. Permission changes are reflected in real-time

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log or activity log section
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays entries for role creation and role assignment with correct timestamps, admin user information, and details of changes made

postconditions: New role is created and stored in the database
Role is visible in the roles management list
User has been assigned the new role successfully
User's permissions reflect the assigned role immediately
All changes are logged in the audit trail
System maintains data integrity and consistency
Admin session remains active

testCases.title: Verify access restriction based on roles
preconditions: Two test user accounts exist in the system
First user account has no role assigned or has a role without performance monitoring permissions
Second user account has a role with specific performance monitoring permissions assigned
Performance monitoring features are active and accessible
Role-based access control is properly configured
Test environment is isolated to prevent affecting production users

steps.action: Log out from the System Administrator account if currently logged in
steps.expectedResult: Successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Log in using credentials of the user without the required role for performance monitoring
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful. User is authenticated and redirected to their default dashboard or home page

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the Performance Metrics page by clicking on the navigation menu or entering the URL directly
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied. User receives an error message (e.g., 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this page' or 'Unauthorized Access'). User is either redirected to their home page or shown a 403 Forbidden page. Navigation menu does not display restricted features

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the Review Cycles page
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message. User cannot access the restricted feature

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the Reporting page
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message. User cannot access the restricted feature

steps.action: Attempt to access restricted API endpoints directly using browser developer tools or API testing tool (e.g., GET /api/reports/performance)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code. No sensitive data is returned. Error response includes appropriate message about insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify that the user can only access features appropriate to their role or default user permissions
steps.expectedResult: User can access only non-restricted features. UI correctly hides or disables restricted menu items and buttons

steps.action: Log out from the restricted user account
steps.expectedResult: Successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Log in using credentials of the user with the assigned role that includes performance monitoring permissions
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful. User is authenticated and redirected to their dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the Performance Metrics page
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted. Performance Metrics page loads successfully. User can view performance metrics data according to their role permissions. Page displays within 3 seconds

steps.action: Navigate to the Review Cycles page
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted. Review Cycles page loads successfully. User can view review cycle information according to their role permissions

steps.action: Navigate to the Reporting page
steps.expectedResult: Access is granted if role includes reporting permissions. User can access reporting features according to their specific role permissions. All permitted features are functional

steps.action: Verify that the user can perform actions allowed by their role (e.g., view metrics, generate reports if permitted)
steps.expectedResult: All actions permitted by the assigned role are functional and accessible. User can successfully complete tasks within their permission scope

steps.action: Attempt to access features not included in the user's role permissions
steps.expectedResult: Access to unpermitted features is denied even for users with some permissions. System enforces granular permission control. Appropriate error messages are displayed for denied actions

steps.action: Check audit logs for access attempts
steps.expectedResult: All access attempts (both successful and denied) are logged with timestamps, user information, and accessed resources. Unauthorized access attempts are clearly marked in the logs

postconditions: Users without required roles cannot access restricted performance monitoring features
Users with assigned roles can access permitted features successfully
No unauthorized access to sensitive performance data occurred
All access attempts are logged in the audit trail
System security and data integrity are maintained
Role-based access control is functioning as designed
Test users are logged out

storyTitle: As Performance Manager, I want to export performance metrics and review data to share with stakeholders

testCases.title: Validate successful export of selected data
preconditions: User is logged in as Performance Manager with export permissions
Performance metrics and review data are available in the system
Browser supports file downloads
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to Metrics or Review Data page
steps.expectedResult: Metrics or Review Data page is displayed with available data sets and export option visible

steps.action: Select specific data sets to export using checkboxes or selection controls
steps.expectedResult: Selected data sets are highlighted and selection count is displayed

steps.action: Choose export format from dropdown (PDF or Excel)
steps.expectedResult: Export format is selected and displayed in the format selector

steps.action: Click the 'Export' or 'Download' button to initiate export
steps.expectedResult: Export process begins, progress indicator is shown, and file generation starts

steps.action: Wait for file generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: File is generated within 10 seconds and download prompt appears or file automatically downloads

steps.action: Verify the downloaded file is saved to the local system
steps.expectedResult: File is successfully downloaded with correct filename, format extension, and contains the selected data matching applied filters and criteria

postconditions: Export file is saved to user's download folder
File contains accurate data matching the selected criteria
Export action is logged in system audit trail
User remains on the same page ready for additional operations

testCases.title: Verify access control for export functionality
preconditions: User is logged in with unauthorized role (not Performance Manager)
Export functionality exists in the system
Access control rules are configured properly

steps.action: Navigate to Metrics or Review Data page as unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Page loads but export functionality is either hidden or disabled

steps.action: Attempt to access export feature by clicking export button or using direct URL to export endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message (e.g., 'You do not have permission to export data' or 403 Forbidden), and no export file is generated

steps.action: Verify that no export options or buttons are accessible to the unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Export controls remain disabled or hidden, preventing any export attempts

postconditions: No data is exported
Access denial is logged in security audit trail
User remains on current page without system disruption
System security integrity is maintained
